titles.title: Emergency Responder Radio Communications Protection Act of 2014
To amend title 18, United States Code, to prohibit interference with communication frequencies used by emergency response providers.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary: 3/11/2014--Introduced. Emergency Responder Radio Communications Protection Act of 2014 - Amends the federal criminal code to prohibit knowingly: (1) interfering with the working or use of any radio frequency used by emergency response providers; or (2) obstructing, hindering, or delaying the transmission of any communication over any such frequency.
